verses.verse: To the chief Musician<WH5329>, A Psalm<WH4210> of David<WH1732>. I waited<WH6960> patiently<WH6960> for the LORD<WH3068>; and he inclined<WH5186> unto me, and heard<WH8085> my cry<WH7775>. I waited: Heb. In waiting I waited

He brought me up<WH5927> also out of an horrible<WH7588> pit<WH953>, out of the miry<WH3121> clay<WH2916>, and set<WH6965> my feet<WH7272> upon a rock<WH5553>, and established<WH3559> my goings<WH838>. an: Heb. a pit of noise

And he hath put<WH5414> a new<WH2319> song<WH7892> in my mouth<WH6310>, even praise<WH8416> unto our God<WH430>: many<WH7227> shall see<WH7200> it, and fear<WH3372>, and shall trust<WH982> in the LORD<WH3068>.
Blessed<WH835> is that man<WH1397> that maketh<WH7760> the LORD<WH3068> his trust<WH4009>, and respecteth<WH6437> not the proud<WH7295>, nor such as turn aside<WH7750> to lies<WH3577>.

Many<WH7227>, O LORD<WH3068> my God<WH430>, are thy wonderful<WH6381> works which thou hast done<WH6213>, and thy thoughts<WH4284> which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order<WH6186> unto thee: if I would declare<WH5046> and speak<WH1696> of them, they are more<WH6105> than can be numbered<WH5608>. they cannot: or, none can order them unto thee

Sacrifice<WH2077> and offering<WH4503> thou didst not desire<WH2654>; mine ears<WH241> hast thou opened<WH3738>: burnt offering<WH5930> and sin offering<WH2401> hast thou not required<WH7592>. opened: Heb. digged
Then said<WH559> I, Lo, I come<WH935>: in the volume<WH4039> of the book<WH5612> it is written<WH3789> of me,
I delight<WH2654> to do<WH6213> thy will<WH7522>, O my God<WH430>: yea, thy law<WH8451> is within<WH8432> my heart<WH4578>. within: Heb. in the midst of my bowels
I have preached<WH1319> righteousness<WH6664> in the great<WH7227> congregation<WH6951>: lo, I have not refrained<WH3607> my lips<WH8193>, O LORD<WH3068>, thou knowest<WH3045>.

I have not hid<WH3680> thy righteousness<WH6666> within<WH8432> my heart<WH3820>; I have declared<WH559> thy faithfulness<WH530> and thy salvation<WH8668>: I have not concealed<WH3582> thy lovingkindness<WH2617> and thy truth<WH571> from the great<WH7227> congregation<WH6951>.
Withhold<WH3607> not thou thy tender mercies<WH7356> from me, O LORD<WH3068>: let thy lovingkindness<WH2617> and thy truth<WH571> continually<WH8548> preserve<WH5341> me.

For innumerable<WH4557> evils<WH7451> have compassed<WH661> me about: mine iniquities<WH5771> have taken hold<WH5381> upon me, so that I am not able<WH3201> to look up<WH7200>; they are more<WH6105> than the hairs<WH8185> of mine head<WH7218>: therefore my heart<WH3820> faileth<WH5800> me. falleth: Heb. forsaketh
Be pleased<WH7521>, O LORD<WH3068>, to deliver<WH5337> me: O LORD<WH3068>, make haste<WH2363> to help<WH5833> me.

Let them be ashamed<WH954> and confounded<WH2659> together<WH3162> that seek<WH1245> after my soul<WH5315> to destroy<WH5595> it; let them be driven<WH5472> backward<WH268> and put to shame<WH3637> that wish<WH2655> me evil<WH7451>.
Let them be desolate<WH8074> for a reward<WH6118> of their shame<WH1322> that say<WH559> unto me, Aha<WH1889>, aha<WH1889>.
Let all those that seek<WH1245> thee rejoice<WH7797> and be glad<WH8055> in thee: let such as love<WH157> thy salvation<WH8668> say<WH559> continually<WH8548>, The LORD<WH3068> be magnified<WH1431>.
But I am poor<WH6041> and needy<WH34>; yet the Lord<WH136> thinketh<WH2803> upon me: thou art my help<WH5833> and my deliverer<WH6403>; make no tarrying<WH309>, O my God<WH430>.
